bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Henry Hanson to Laura Armistead Carter, November 1, 1932

div1.p: Hanson looks forward to seeing Carter when he is in Birmingham for a meeting of the Southern Medical Association, the National Malaria Committee, and the American Society of Tropical Medicine.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Hanson to Laura Armistead Carter, November 1, 1932
div1.opener:
IN GOD WE TRUST
Florida State Board of Health
HENRY HANSON, M. D., STATE HEALTH OFFICER
JACKSONVILLE
THE BOARD
H. MASON SMITH, M. D. PRES,
TAMPA
HENRY E. PALMER, M. D.
TALLAHASSEE
EDWARD M. L'ENGLE, M. D.
JACKSONVILLE
November 1, 1932
Miss Laura Carter
c/o Dr. Henry Rose Carter, Jr.
908 Protective Life Building
Birmingham, Ala.
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I am very pleased to have your letter of
October 27th telling me that you are still in Birmingham.
I shall be very glad of an opportunity to see you sometime
during the meeting of the Southern Medical Association, the
National Malaria Committee and the American Society of Tropical
Medicine convening in Birmingham between the 16th and 18th of
November. I have made reservations at the Tutwiler Hotel for
this meeting.

Since you mention our Library you would be
interested to know that we have found an old copy of the
Surgeon General's report in which your Father's discussion
of extrinsic and intrinsic incubation in yellow fever is recorded.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely, Henry Hanson HH.B
P.S. I do not think Mrs. Hanson will be along since I have some
special tours of investigation to make immediately preceding
the Birmingham meeting.
